body.p: This time I tell them about trapping business and I tell some things I know myself about white fellows that trap skunk and mink and like that when season closed worse than Indians. White fellow game warden just watch Indian and when he catch poor Indian think he is big guy and take him jail and try to make him pay fine by judge and Indian don’t have money and can’t pay fine and stay in jail. I am trapper and I am hunter too and I know myself white fellows just as bad as Indian and lots of time I find white man trap without tag and lots of time too I hear gun shot and I know he don’t shoot at squirrel. I am not game warden and I am Indian reporter and just like farmer and I don’t say anything when I find trap that don’t have tag and when I see hunter I just walk by and I don’t even speak to him. Game warden meet me in woods two three years ago and he walk up to me and say “Hey Frisk did you see fellow hunting over on other side?” and I tell him “No I don’t see nobody,” and every time I tell them same thing. Lots of Indians now work at sort cranberries at marshes and give work to quite a few fellows and get pretty good pay too. Everybody need work now so can buy heavy clothes for winter and every time Indian get job sorting cranberries he feel pretty good. Some marshes pay Indian workers 15 cents an hour. Fred Sam from Wittenberg he come to Indian hospital four five days and have swell up his hand and arm and doctors try to fix it and he tell Indian reporter he maybe get better now. Joe Green and Herschel Thompson they are two young Indian fellows from Neillsville and Saturday they come to Tomah to see Indian reporter. I just see Frank Rehberg go by and everybody all Indians know him and call him fish king and he come through by our way and sell fish and meat to Indians and white people too. Indian reporter always have joke and big laugh with fish king. I eat his sausage he sell and I think pretty good and don’t kill me yet. Indian reporter have girl friend just young girl over in Michigan and I meet her at Wisconsin Dells and this week I get letter from her. Everybody say I am too old buck to have young girl friend. Whenever I get money I want to go Michigan and see her. .
